entry.et: Middle English, from Late Latin funeralis, from Latin funer-, funus funeral (noun)

def.dt: :of, relating to, or constituting a funeral

entry.et: Middle English funerelles (plural), from Middle French funerailles (plural), from Medieval Latin funeralia (plural), from Late Latin, neuter plural of funeralis, adjective

def.dt: :the observances held for a dead person usually before burial or cremation
:a matter of concern to one :worry if you flunk, it's your funeral
:one whose profession is the management of funerals and who is usually an embalmer
:an establishment with facilities for the preparation of the dead for burial or cremation, for the viewing of the body, and for funerals called also funeral parlor
